SEARCH
Package org.myshelfie.network.client

Class Client

java.lang.Object
java.rmi.server.RemoteObject
java.rmi.server.RemoteServer
java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
org.myshelfie.network.client.Client
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Runnable, Remote, ClientRMIInterface
public class Client extends UnicastRemoteObject implements ClientRMIInterface, Runnable
This class represents a client that can connect to the server via RMI or Socket. The client is a network object used by the CLI and GUI.
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • Client

      public Client() throws RemoteException
      Constructor used by the Server class to create a Client based on the nickname received via socket
      Throws:
      RemoteException - if the remote object cannot be exported

    • Client

      public Client(boolean isGUI, boolean isRMI, String serverAddress) throws RemoteException
      Constructor for the client.
      Parameters:
      isGUI - true if the client is a GUI, false if it is a CLI
      isRMI - true if the client uses RMI, false if it uses Socket
      serverAddress - the address of the server. Can be a hostname or an IP address
      Throws:
      RemoteException - if the remote object cannot be exported

    • Client

      public Client(ClientRMIInterface rmiInterface) throws RemoteException
      Constructor for the client, used in the RMI version, to get a Client object starting from the published RMI interface.
      Parameters:
      rmiInterface - the RMI interface of the client
      Throws:
      RemoteException - if the RMI connection fails

  • Method Details

    • connect

      public void connect()
      Establish the connection to the server, be it RMI or Socket.

    • endLoginPhase

      public void endLoginPhase()
      End the login phase in the pre-game stage. This calls the View.endLoginPhase() method, to change the scene accordingly.

    • endLobbyPhase

      public void endLobbyPhase()
      End the lobby phase in the pre-game stage. This calls the View.endLobbyPhase() method, to change the scene accordingly.

    • startServerListener

      public void startServerListener()
      Start to listen for messages from the server via socket.

    • getGameName

      public String getGameName()
      Getter for the name of the game the client is playing in.
      Returns:
      the name of the game

    • setLastHeartbeat

      public void setLastHeartbeat(long l)
      Setter for the last heartbeat of the client
      Parameters:
      l - the last heartbeat, as a timestamp

    • getLastHeartBeat

      public long getLastHeartBeat()
      Getter for the last heartbeat of the client
      Returns:
      the last heartbeat, as a timestamp

    • initializeView

      public void initializeView(View view)
      Assign a view to the client.
      Parameters:
      view - the view to assign (either ViewGUI or ViewCLI

    • getView

      public View getView()
      Getter for the view of the client
      Returns:
      the View of the client

    • update

      public void update(GameView argument, GameEvent ev) throws RemoteException
      Update of the client after the GameView has been modified (or an Error has been received)
      Specified by:
      update in interface ClientRMIInterface
      Parameters:
      argument - GameView in case of a model change, String in case of an error
      ev - Type of the information received
      Throws:
      RemoteException

    • updateRMI

      public void updateRMI(GameView argument, GameEvent ev) throws RemoteException
      Remote method called by the server to update an RMI client. Will call the update(org.myshelfie.network.messages.gameMessages.GameView, org.myshelfie.network.messages.gameMessages.GameEvent) method
      Parameters:
      argument - GameView in case of a model change, String in case of an error
      ev - Type of the information received
      Throws:
      RemoteException - if the RMI connection fails

    • startHeartBeatThread

      public void startHeartBeatThread()
      Start a heartbeat thread, that will periodically send a heartbeat message to the server.

    • stopHeartbeatThread

      public void stopHeartbeatThread()
      Stop the thread that periodically send the heartbeat message to the server.

    • run

      public void run()
      Specified by:
      run in interface Runnable

    • updateServer

      public void updateServer(CommandMessageWrapper msg)
      Send an update to the server after a user performs an action, using RMI or Socket depending on the type of client
      Parameters:
      msg - Message containing information about the command to send to the server

    • updateServerPreGame

      public Object updateServerPreGame(CommandMessageWrapper msg)
      Update the server during pre-game session by handling separetely RMI and Socket
      Parameters:
      msg - Message containing information about the event (NICKNAME, CREATE_GAME or JOIN_GAME)
      Returns:
      Server response, whose type depends on the type of event

    • sendHeartbeatRMI

      private void sendHeartbeatRMI()
      Send a heartbeat message to the server every HEARTBEAT_INTERVAL milliseconds. This calls the remote method heartbeat() of the server and should thus be used only by an "RMI" client. This method is supposed to be run inside a dedicated thread.

    • sendHeartbeatSocket

      private void sendHeartbeatSocket()
      Send a heartbeat message to the server every HEARTBEAT_INTERVAL milliseconds. This method should be used only by a "socket" client, and is supposed to be run inside a dedicated thread.

    • getNickname

      public String getNickname()
      Getter for the nickname of the client
      Specified by:
      getNickname in interface ClientRMIInterface
      Returns:
      the nickname of the client

    • setNickname

      public void setNickname(String nickname)
      Setter for the nickname of the client
      Parameters:
      nickname - the new nickname of the client

    • isRMI

      public boolean isRMI()
      Returns:
      true if the client is an RMI client, false if it is a socket client

    • getClientSocket

      public Socket getClientSocket()
      Get the client socket, to which the server can send messages
      Returns:
      the Socket of the client

    • setClientSocket

      public void setClientSocket(Socket clientSocket)
      Set the client socket, to save the reference to which send messages
      Parameters:
      clientSocket - the new Socket of the client
